newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Highlights of Monday's Commission briefing.
newsitem.headline: Highlights of Monday's Commission briefing.

text.p: Following are highlights of the midday briefing by the European Commission on Monday:

Spokesman Peter Guilford briefed on today's EU/Japan meeting. He said the agenda of Commissioner Sir Leon Brittan and Japanese Minister of International Trade and Industry Shinji Sato's meeting would include World Trade Organisation related issues, the preparation of the Association of South East Asian Nations economy ministers' meeting and EU/Japan trade relations. Guilford said the meeting would be followed by a lunch as well as a briefing at 1500/1400 GMT in the Breydel news room.

Asked about Bank of Austria's buying of Creditanstalt, spokesman Willy Helin said there had been no formal notification yet. He also confirmed that one of the bidders for Creditanstalt had lodged a complaint with the Commission.
The Commission released the following documents:
- Speech/97/3: Speech by Commissioner Hans van den Broek at the TACIS national coordinators' meeting.
- Eurostat news release No 1/97: Inflation of 2.2% in November 1996: a new minimum record.
